metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7210 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox before 43.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.5 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by triggering attempted use of a data channel that has been closed by a WebRTC function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7210` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
